text: Thank you <@U022WPACV4L>, this is exactly what I was looking for! I'm currently part of a 2-person, so this makes perfect sense

elements.text: , this is exactly what I was looking for! I'm currently part of a 2-person, so this makes perfect sense

text:
I want to add that both however require a more technical lingo and skillset when it comes to content. And this is just my experience with working with startups and larger content media publications with a full team.

Startups are going to be more niche-focused to their target consumers so more experience with their products and services will be the biggest point to learn with this level of content. Whereas FAANG tech can be more broad topics and niche because there is a largely established audience presence.

In the simplest forms of content there
is also a difference in the type of content startups you will see landing pages, blog posts, and white papers whereas FAANG you will landing pages, blogs, articles, video content marketing, and social media more than say white papers.
